page.title: 02Village Description (Cont.)
page.content: The River Culm has in the past flooded the centre of the village but recent improvement work should have removed this hazard without,in any way,spoiling the old bridge.The five stone arches,three of twenty feet and two of sixteen feet reflect the solid timeless feeling of the valley.The Culm provided power as well as excellant meadow land for Culmstock and although now turned into residential buildings the old mills remain the same from the outside as they have for many years.The same may be said for the old coaching inn and forge.While there is very little evidence to show where the railway once ran the layout of the village and its general appearance would probably be easily recognisable to the forefathers of many of the families who still live in the village.
